pullRequest.title: 187 consume settings in Copybook Service
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose of this PR is to fix #187  and fix #218.
More in detail:

[ENHANCEMENT] #218: The dependency service is defined in an appropriate class, with its own unit test and is defined as DI for the Copybook Service
[FEATURE] #187: When user update its settings related to the copybook manager, the LSP server is able to detect the changes, populate the inner structure and consume it searching for copybooks in the location specified by the settings.

nodes.bodyText: A setter should be used here
Due to https://github.com/google/guice/wiki/Injections injecting a final field is a bad practice
Please, use a direct instantiation instead of DI
There is no need to use DI here, it is better to create an object with new
Please, mock it instead of instantiation
I think everything here should be private
Please, replace it with logging
Why is it protected?
Why do you use a provider for provider? Injecting SettingsProvider is enough here
Why do you compare copybookName with a whitespace?
To keep the naming convention, it is better to call this class "FileSystemUtils"
The method name is syntactically incorrect, it would better to call it something like "checkFileHasValidExtension"
The method name is syntactically incorrect, it would better to call it something like "checkFileExists"

By purpose of data consistency, it is better to keep this class immutable and remove the builder. If there is a default value required, it is better to create a special static method and return an empty value there.
If it is a SIngleton, Builder is not applicable here.
This should be injected in the constructor
Please, replace it with a static call for the default value.
Please, wrap it with Collections.immutableList
Technically, it is not deep copying due to you build a new instance using the same objects
in order to get rid of multiple if statements you may return the message into the method which makes the check (i.e copybookFolderNotDefined() )
if there was a problem with the JSON then why are you building the settings?
you may correct the name to retrieve I believe
please replace with log
log please
you may add log here as well
